content.question: Which of the following correctly compares the angular displacements <math alttext="delta theta sub A" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi> <msub> <mi>θ</mi> <mtext>A</mtext> </msub> </mstyle> </math> and <math alttext="delta theta sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> of disks <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, respectively, during the period shown, and provides a correct reasoning?

choices.label: <math alttext="delta theta sub A equals delta theta sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> because Disk <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> has a greater angular velocity at the end of the time interval shown.

<math alttext="delta theta sub A equals delta theta sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> because neither curve has a decreasing slope.

<math alttext="delta theta sub A does not equal delta theta sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>≠</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> because Disk <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> stops rotating after <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> second.

<math alttext="delta theta sub A does not equal delta theta sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>≠</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> because the area under Disk <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>’s curve is greater than the area under Disk <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>’s curve.

content.answer: <math alttext="delta theta sub A does not equal delta theta sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>≠</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> because the area under Disk <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>’s curve is greater than the area under Disk <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>’s curve.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
